Overwatch, this game is like a 'complicated' relationship. At first, she was the enchanting goddess who captivated me, with her beauty and all those fancy high-tier skins that made me daydream. But as time went on, I realized that her true nature was far from perfect. She updates at the speed of a snail, making me wait forever to see any progress. Not only that, she's filled with repetitions and delays, almost as if she's deliberately testing my patience. She promised me a fantastic PvE system, only for me to discover it was all just a big hoax, a stack of lies! The arrival of Overwatch 2 made me feel like she simply changed her outfit but remained the same old boring self. I even suspect this might be the game developer's 'pre-marital money-making plan': shutting down the original servers, then releasing a new version to squeeze more cash. Overwatch, you've made me question both gaming and relationships, but thank you for giving me an intriguing and twisted experience. At least I've learned to stay cautious and rational in the virtual world!

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.
